page.title: 13Employment in Gillingham
page.content: After the closure of the Dockyard in 1984 Gillingham's employment rate wasn't very good. But despite this many people are employed at the Hempstead Valley on the outskirts of the town in the new shopping complex. The jobs are quite well paid because of the long hours the employees haves to put in. (From 8.30 to 6.30 or 7-8.30, if you work in the Savacentre). This shopping complex provides great competition against the Gillingham Shopping Pedestrian precinct and the Chatham Pentagon Centre. Out of all the shops in Hempstead Valley Shopping Centre the one which employ the most people is Savacsntre because it employs management, cleaners, cashiers and store detectives plus shelf stockers.
